content.description: Climb a featured slab to a ledge below a blank band. Pull delicate moves to an immaculate face. Final boulder problem below the chains is the crux. If your under 6ft, its probably closer to 12 than 11, for taller folks it might feel significantly easier.
An easy sport climb that moves from right to left up a slabby arete.
content.protection: Quickdraws are all you need. There is a two bolt anchor at the top, no chains or rap rings. Belay from here and walk off, or lower off two draws and then walk back up to retrieve them.
content.location: This is the leftmost of three bolted lines on the far right end of the main buttress. One Move Wonder starts just right of a large tree growing very close to the main wall.

content.description: Climb prominent weakness to the splitter hand/ fist crack at the top of the wall. Can't imagine it hasn't been climbed before so if you have an earlier ascent and name let me know.
content.protection: Small to medium nuts/cams, with a few hand and fist (#2-3) sized pieces for the top, ends at chains. Anchor for this route is accessible from the top and can be used to TR Come as You Are.
content.location: Look for the trough/cracks left of Come As You Are. Almost shares a start with this route.

content.description: Same start as Crack Attack. Fork right under the roof and pull some big moves through the roof to easier bulges at the finish. NO ANCHORS ON THIS ROUTE ! Walk off only.
content.protection: 6 bolts with NO ANCHORS as of 6/28/2020.
content.location: Right route under distinct roof. Just right of Crack Attack on the upper end of the South Butress.

content.description: Climb up cracks and horizontal seams through a series of bulges.
content.protection: Gear up to 1". Rap ring anchors.
content.location: To the Right of Come As You Are on the upper half of The South Buttress.

content.description: The route begins on an easy, although run out face. Climb to the big horizontal crack about forty feet up. It would be wise to construct an anchor here, because this is the only pro to be found for the crux. Continue past the bulge, and mantle up to where you can gain the crack system. Follow the good crack to the top.
content.location: This route is located in the center of the Main Buttress, right of Blue Monday. Walk off or rappel the route to get down.

content.description: Dos Amigos is a great, easy, two pitch sport climb. The first pitch climbs a slabby face up to a great belay ledge for approximately sixty feet. The second pitch is excellent, with interesting rock leading to the top, about eighty feet.
content.protection: The entire route is bolted, including anchors at the top of both pitches. If you would prefer to walk off the top, the location of the anchor is somewhat inconvenient. In this case, bring a few hand sized cams and climb past the anchor. There is a good crack that drops into the rock beneath your feet. This crack is located a few feet back from the top edge of the cliff. An anchor to bring up the second can be easily built here. Otherwise, just rappel the route.
content.location: Dos Amigos is situated at the northeast corner of the Main Buttress. It is possible to walk off the route. Otherwise, make two single rope rappels using the same anchors as on the way up.

content.description: Start at a slightly dislodged block. Climb bulges with horizontal seams to a cool roof. Pull some big moves over the roof to a slippery blank slab finish.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchors. Can be top roped. Chains anchors are accessible from the top.
content.location: Just to the right of One Move Wonder. The left route under a cool distinct roof.

content.description: Climb cool face holds through a series of bulges. A low crux at a small roof might make you think a little. Well bolted for first time leads and a great warmup.
content.location: A little over halfway up the South Buttress from Dos Amigos, look for a pine tree near the wall. The route is on the right side of the tree just past a crack.

content.description: This is an interesting line. The route begins with a dihedral, and then a fun move to the right to get on top of a column. Stem past a slabby section and a chickenhead to the crack. Continue up and slightly left to the belay ledge.
content.protection: A standard rack will get you up this climb. There is a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: This route is located just right of the bolted route Dos Amigos. Rappel the route to descend.
